comment: She is very cool and but doesn't put in effort for us to learn. She told us she was previously a software engineer so this is her retirement job and it shows. Since this is an ethics course (and is not one of the technical courses the major) I am GLAD that it IS EASY. I would not take her for a technical course where I really want to learn.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I got an A in this class but you have to be very careful. Make sure you read & do well in her quizzes & assignments. Never miss or be late to turn them in because you won't survive the penalty. There are two group assignment but its only 10% of the grade so don't sweat it if you are stuck with a bad group. Miss class & you may miss the credit bonus
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Foster for Practice and Ethics. The class itself is pretty boring but it is an easy A. She reads from the slides but she loves getting into discussions with classmates about certain topics which can be entertaining. The assignments were all pretty easy.

I took her for Intro to SWE. She mainly reads from the slides but she does go into depth and will answer any questions that you may have. She's a very kind and caring teacher and will help you as much as she can. There was a lot of homework, but it was only review at the end of the chapters.

She mostly spends every lecture reading from power points. Thankfully you don't need to go to class. Although, she is still better than most CCSE Profs, but that says more about the CCSE department than her. You can do a presentation about your group project for an extra 10%. You want to make sure you are there on the last day/review for final..

do not take this class if u really want to learn something . Tests and final are super hard, very hard to understand . No help from the teacher even asking multiple times and grading system does not help but make it very tough to do well in the class. Do not expect any last minute grade change tests and final carries a huge percent overall.

Like everybody else mentioned, tough grader. The final we took was ugly. Not like I do not understand the material but it was like a word puzzle. You had to read it many times and then there was only one word different from the definition. If you are not VERY efficient in reading/understanding do not take her and trust me reading books is my hobby.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Everything is straight from the book/slides. Problem is that its hard to interpret the opinion of the author of the book. Not leanant at all so do NOT miss an assignment. Tough grader. Dont recommend.

This class was online. She put the final exam up for only two hours of the day, never seen professor to that in an online class. When I emailed her about my concern that I have to work etc., she did not bother to respond - this will tell you how much she cares about her students. Her grading is also terrible. I would only advise not to take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Oh man, this professor is awful. It is sad that KSU does not really give you more choices to take this class with other professors. Unbearable grader. Thank God this was my last class ever. Well, good luck if you take her, I strongly suggest you avoid her.

Very conceited. Gave us a vague reference to help the class with an assignment then said If it is confusing you then dont use it, after 3 condescending paragraphs meant to make us feel dumb. Basically a ghost teacher. IF you do have a question you'll feel worse for asking. She grades very harshly and only allows for very specific answers. AVOID HER

Conceited; only reads the slides during lectures. When I received a grade for a group project, there was no feedback as promised and the grade changed at random three times since. At this point, I haven't shown up to class since then (about two months) and I think my grade has actually improved. Book was listed as mandatory, but changed her mind.

If you point out to her any issue or seek help she will basically call you out on it. Very rude and egoistical professor. Assignments? Basically just hard book exercises. Grading? You think you did well? Well, if it is not the way she wanted it, you will fail. In SWE there is not only 1 solution, in her mind there is. Avoid her at all costs, please
